data.title: Research & Learn
data.meta_description: Our mission is to encourage the joy of reading, the exploration of ideas, and the pursuit of lifelong learning for the children and adults of our community.
data.text:
Encyclopedia Britannica for elementary school students. Lets students look for people, places and things, watch and learn with videos and animations, and have fun with games and activities.

View Britannica Elementary

Encyclopedia Britannica for middle school students. Helps students find fast answers and get homework help, explore videos and articles on famous people and places as well as discover maps, photos, and illustrations for school projects.

View Britannica Middle

Geared towards elementary school students, the leading resource for accurate and age-appropriate content in Spanish. New features make it more valuable than ever for native Spanish speakers, bilingual students, and students learning Spanish.

View Britannica Primaria

Geared towards high school students, the leading resource for accurate and age-appropriate content in Spanish. New features make it more valuable than ever for native Spanish speakers, bilingual students, and students learning Spanish.

View Britannica Secundaria

Castle Garden Immigration Center is an educational project of The Battery Conservancy. This free site offers access to an extraordinary database of information on 11 million immigrants from 1820 through 1892.

View Castle Garden Immigration Center

Access to all the ratings, reviews and articles of the magazine, plus frequent updates and a convenient Shop Online feature. Limited to Scarsdale Cardholders.

View Consumer Reports

CQ Researcher provides in-depth coverage of the most important issues of the day. The reports are written by journalists, footnoted and fact-checked. Limited to Scarsdale Cardholders- In Library Use Only.

View [Inside the Library]

In partnership with Driving-Tests.org, the Westchester Library System is proud to offer free New York State Driver Permit practice tests and driver handbooks. Automobile, motorcycle and commercial handbooks and practice tests are available.

View Driving-Tests.org

Provides periodical and journal articles on multiple levels of education from preschool to college, and every educational specialty—such as technology, bilingual education, health education, testing, administration and more.

View Educator's Reference Complete

Designed especially for students in kindergarten through grade five. Complete with an engaging, developmentally appropriate graphic interface, premier reference content and the best magazines for elementary students.

View Gale in Context: Elementary

Created specifically for middle school students, Research In Context combines the best of Gale’s reference content with age-appropriate videos, newspapers, magazines, primary sources, and much more.

View Gale in Context: Middle School

Provides access to a wide range of full-text Spanish- and Portuguese-language scholarly journals and magazines both from and about Latin America.

View Informe Académico

Provides interactive lessons on how to use different types of software to build technology, creative, and business skills, including career development and job search skills. Note: When using the mobile app, the Library ID is: westchesterlibraries.

View Linkedin Learning (formerly Lynda.com)

A collection of images from two sources: digitized from slides collected by the local photographer Harold Haliday Costain; photographs by local photographer Elizabeth Arey. Check back often as more images are being added.

View Local History Photographs at NY Heritage

Issues of the New York Times from 1985 to the Present. Available through General OneFile.

View New York Times (1985-Current)

Full-text articles from regional New York State newspapers. Available through NOVEL, a statewide virtual library provided free to the public by the New York State Library.

View NYS Newspapers

Full-text newspaper database has several NY newspapers, including the NY Times from 1985-Present, as well as over fifty national and international newspapers.

View OneFile News

With initial funding from the Pfizer Foundation and the National Academy of Sciences, VCU has assembled 50 of the best videos from the public television series, “Secrets of the Sequence” to assist teachers in the application of genetic research acros

View Secrets of the Sequences: Video series on the Life Sciences

Más de 1400 videos educativos con información básica de salud sobre enfermedades o afecciones, exámenes y procedimientos médicos.

View Temas de educación para el paciente

The Center for Aging in Place works with communities in Westchester County to support Aging in Place groups and create a new lifestyle for residents who desire to remain independent at home and engaged in community life as they grow olde

View The Center for Aging in Place

The Merck Manuals are one of the world’s most widely used medical information resources. Find information on medical topics, symptoms, drugs, procedures, news and more, written in everyday language.

View The Merck Manuals

TumbleBooks are animated, talking picture books which teach kids the joy of reading in a format they'll love.

View TumbleBooks

Tutor.com provides live homework help from expert tutors, overnight assignment reviews, and practice tests.

View Tutor.com

Brings together the best fashion industry professionals to create lessons that inspire and educate students, teachers, home sewers and the fashion curious.

View University of Fashion

The Value Line Research Center provides online access to Value Line’s leading publications covering stocks, mutual funds, options, and convertible securities, as well as special situation stocks. Limited to Scarsdale Cardholders.

View Value Line
